forumNotes.author: ankur mathur
forumNotes.content: I used Windows ME DOS Disk as my emergency disk for booting and repairing, i have a Transcend 512 MB USB FLASH Drive. When i boot using my ME Startup disk, i want to be able to access the USB disk like any other hard disk drive (Read/Write). My motherboard supports USB FUNCTION IN DOS. Is This Possible?

forumNotes.author: Brito
forumNotes.content:
Yes, it is possible. Google for the USB drivers created for FreeDos - maybe them even come included on their full distribution then you only need to adapt them to work with ME (never tested under ME myself, only using Freedos boot disks) An article here with some methods: [http://www.bootdisk.com/usb.htm](http://www.bootdisk.com/usb.htm "External link") From FreeDOS: [http://www.freedos.o...wsitem/149.html](http://www.freedos.org/freedos/news/newsitem/149.html "External link") And lots of links to very interesting active developments for (Free)DOS: [http://www.freedos.org/freedos/links/](http://www.freedos.org/freedos/links/ "External link")
Good luck! ![:confused1:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/confused1.gif)

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
Actually, not to contradict Nuno, just to add some info, the "reference" boot disk should be this one:  
[http://johnson.tmfc....dos/usbdrv.html](http://johnson.tmfc.net/dos/usbdrv.html "External link")  

Please also check this:  
[http://www.911cd.net...o...=18650\&st=0](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?sho...=18650&st=0 "External link")  
[http://www.911cd.net...o...18650\&st=13](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?sho...18650&st=13 "External link")  
if you are using the DUSE drivers.  

But usually, say 95% of the times, the Panasonic "Motto Hairu" ones do work.  

Look here for a couple interesting threads giving details of the sintax for them:  
[http://www.computing...orum/13288.html](http://www.computing.net/dos/wwwboard/forum/13288.html "External link")  
[http://www.computing...orum/13447.html](http://www.computing.net/dos/wwwboard/forum/13447.html "External link")  

Also, have a look at this:  
[http://www.georgpott.../usb/dosusb.htm](http://www.georgpotthast.de/usb/dosusb.htm "External link")  
(untested by me)  

jaclaz  

P.S.: just for the record these drivers were NOT created for FREEDOS, they were developed from Panasonic and some other Japan companies to support their hardware devices under DOS
